comment: Took this course online & during summer. There were a lot of assignments jammed in 8 weeks but it's possible. Professor Oguzmert allows you to work ahead & at your own pace. He's caring, easy grader, & funny. Wants you to succeed. There were 12 papers including a final research paper & a presentation. Easy A class if you put in the work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: The class was not bad at all, and I am not a fan of group projects. The 1st half of the semester focuses mainly on economics stuff and the 2nd half is a group project. He teaches the material well and the tests aren't super difficult, but the project is a lot of work. My group had someone go MIA and he was very understanding and helpful through it.

Professor Oguzmert is a great professor! He is chill and has good lectures. The class is structured weirdly. The 1st half we study about interest calculations (math + accounting) & the 2nd half is out estimating the cost of construction materials. We had weekly quizzes for the 1st half of the sem and a project for the 2nd half. I liked the class.
Great, caring guy. Usually material is clear to understand. He grades very generously and gives partial credit anywhere he can. Not too much homework, and exams are open note/open book.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Show up for lab and pass
Awesome professor. Really caring and thoughtful! A destinguished mustache and beautiful accent.

Prof. Oguzmert did a great job organizing this class. Clear lecture notes, clear lectures, and lots of examples helped this class go by smoothly. Not too many quizzes or homeworks, but they did help a lot with the 2 tests and final. Open note quizzes, tests, and final due to the large amount of information you learn. Take him when you can!

This is a review of Professor Oguzmert's CE 6102 - Structural Dynamics class. Take it if you can even if you have Transportation or Environmental as a concentration.  Interesting class taught by a professor who 1) cares about his students and 2) knows the topic. For all you undergrads-take Oguzmert if you can regardless of the class. You'll be :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: CE 6002 - Research Methods is a graduate program requirement. Just make sure you take it with Prof. Oguzmert. He is a great professor that obviously cares about his students and what they take away from class.   If you apply yourself in this class, you will learn a lot whether a thesis or non-thesis student. Considerable reading requirements.

Summer course: Structural starts out as a review of statics, then jumps right into the new material. New material is no cake walk, but he made it interesting and understandable. His lecture notes were organized and clear. Printing them out and writing on them is a must. Tests and quizzes are based on HW. Pay attention and do HW and you'll do fine.

Structural Analysis is statics review and then it quickly gets crazy. If you show effort in this class, you will pass. He has notes that you SHOULD print out, summer final was open book open note. HW not graded, but that is where he gets problems for quizzes and tests. He'll use an older version of txtbks so students can get free pdf versions.

Prof. Oguzmert structured this class to be as clear cut as possible. Explains things very clearly and starts the next class by reviewing the last lecture. Gives plenty of examples and bonus problems. 7 quizzes, one is dropped. 2 midterms, all based on HW. Department makes final. Just pay attention, show up, do ALL HW and you'll get a good grade.

He is a great teacher because he goes over examples at a good pace and in detail. Definitely would take him again. Gives extra credit. Assigns the right amount of homework to do. And if you do all the homework you will get an A.
You will understand everything with Dr. Oguzmert. He's very organized with his lecture notes.

Attendance isn't mandatory but it will be hard to make an A unless you go to every class. He has really improved in the last year and a half. Still the BEST instructor in the CCE department. Definitely knows the subject and is VERY helpful. Take his courses whenever they are offered. You will learn all the basics and then some!!!

Great Professor. Knows his material.students, with love and respect, call him oguzee, just not in front of him of course. His tone in class can be improved. If anyone is reading this, then please make sure you drink a large cup of coffee or soda to keep awake in his class as his tone is just monotonic and you will fall sleep faster than you think.
Excellent Professor. He knows structural design and teaches it better than anyone! Attend class to get the most out of this course. Outstanding instructor!!!
Excellent Professor. Design of Wood Structures is a technical elective and he will teach you all the important principles to use after graduation. This is the BEST professor in the CCE department
Great teacher. Gives handouts in class and describes each problem in great detail. test and quiz problems come from homework.
Great professor.  Down-to-earth and goes out of his way to help you.
He provides handouts and discusses the material thoroughly in class. He was nominated for the SPSU Faculty Award. His grading system is very fair and you will learn a lot from him.
Dr. Oguzmert is a wonderful professor. He made sure that the subject was explained fully. The tests/quizzes are based heavily on the homework. Book required!

concrete isn't a easy subject. you have to understand the concept. professor understands the subject, especially code interpretation.extremely helpful! he will answer your question thoroughly without being agitated.if you love structures.... this is the guy to learn from!
Fall 2011 was his first semester as an instructor. Previously worked as structural engineer in California. He has an excellent command of the subject matter and is very helpful.
